result.execSummary:
The defendant Guillermo Alvarez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Maintain FTE/schooling.  Anytime so not engaged, 9 hours community service per week.

Any assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by agent.  AODA and any follow up.   Absolute sobriety. 

DNA sample.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Guillermo Alvarez

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Plea and Sentencing Hearing 
Jan. 18th, 2017
Judge Strasser

Clerk Charli.
Case Called: 8:22 a.m.
INCLUDE: 15CF999, 15CM984, 15CM1267, 16CF531, 16CF797

State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo.  Def appears in person with Atty Sharon Gisselman.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.

Atty Mayo states Jail Credit is to be determined;
Atty Gisselman in agreement; 
Counsel to submit sentence credit to Court  

State moves to:
15CF999-
Ct. 2 (OAR- Repeater)>> DRI
15CM984-
Ct. 2 (Operating While Revoked- Repeater)>> DRI
15CM1267-
Ct. 1 (Operating While Revoked- Repeater)>> DRI
Ct. 2 (BJ- MISD- Repeater)>> DRI
16CF531-
Ct. 1 (Possess w/ Intent- Amphetamine- 2nd Offense- Repeater)>> DRI
Ct. 2 (Possess with Intent- THC- Repeater- Second Offense)>> DRI
Ct. 3 (BJ- Felony)>> DRI
Ct. 4 (Possess Drug Paraphernalia- Repeater)>> DRI
16CF797-
Ct. 3 (Possession of Narcotic Drugs- Repeater)>> DRI
Ct. 4 (Possess with Intent- THC- Repeater- 2nd Offense)>> DRI
Ct. 5 (BJ- Felony)>> DRI
Ct. 6 (Carry Concealed Weapon- Repeater)>> DRI
COURT grants above.

PLEA:
15CF999-
Ct. 1 (Possession of Methamphetamine- Repeater)>> GUILTY
15CM984-
Ct. 1 (Obstructing an Officer- Repeater)>> GUILTY
16CF797-
Ct. 1 (Possess Firearm- Repeater)>> GUILTY
Ct. 2 (Flee/Elude Officer- Repeater)>> GUILTY

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 

COURT ORDERS:

15CF999:
Ct. 1- 6 years Prison (4 years IC/ 2 years ES) to run concurrent to all; CONDITIONS: Any assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by agent; AODA and any follow up; Maintain full time work/school, anytime not so engaged, 9 hours of CS per week; Absolute Sobriety; DNA Sample & Surcharge; CC.
15CM984:
Ct. 1- 2 years Prison (1 years IC/ 1 year ES) to run concurrent to all; CONDITIONS: Any assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by agent; AODA and any follow up; Maintain full time work/school, anytime not so engaged, 9 hours of CS per week; Absolute Sobriety; DNA Sample & Surcharge; CC.
16CF797
Ct. 1- 7 years Prison (4 years IC/ 3 years ES) to run concurrent to all; CONDITIONS: Any assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by agent; AODA and any follow up; Maintain full time work/school, anytime not so engaged, 9 hours of CS per week; Absolute Sobriety; DNA Sample & Surcharge; CC.
Ct. 2- 6 years Prison (4 years IC/ 2 years ES) to run concurrent to all; CONDITIONS: Any assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by agent; AODA and any follow up; Maintain full time work/school, anytime not so engaged, 9 hours of CS per week; Absolute Sobriety; DNA Sample & Surcharge; CC.

COURT Orders Deft is Eligible for all Prison Programming effective immediately.

Adj: 8:44 a.m.

Cases 15CM1267, 15CM984, 15CF999, 16CF797, 16CF531 called: 9:34am
State appears by ADA K.Mayo; Defendant appears in person/in custody and with Attorney Sharon Gisselman

Atty Gisselman notes main request for modification of bond in case 16CF797 and makes argument on bond reduction.
Argument on modification by State - notes cash bond also in 16CF531.

COURT denies motion for bond modication - COURT directs parties to set matter for further dates immediately at the conclusion of this hearing.

State does not oppose request for return of bond; Defense states Poster is not present today as she had surgery yesterday.
